required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Educating and Supporting Primary Care Providers in the Implementation of Evidence-based Practices for ADHD
clinical_study.official_title: Educating and Supporting Primary Care Providers in the Implementation of Evidence-based Practices for ADHD

brief_summary.textblock: Although numerous studies have demonstrated that a high percentage of primary care providers (PCPs) are knowledgeable about the American Academy of Pediatrics' guidelines for managing ADHD, many fail to implement these guidelines correctly. The goal of this project is to increase the use of evidence-based practices (EBP) for assessing and treating children with ADHD between 5 and 12 years in the context of primary care practice. This randomized controlled trial will evaluate the whether a 3-part intervention (education about ADHD management and communication training, collaborative consultation, and performance feedback regarding use of EBPs) is effective in improving EBP use among primary care providers.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Patients Who Were Sent the Parents Rating Scale
primary_outcome.description: This measure is based on chart review of patients of clinicians in each study arm (up to 4 patients per clinician) and reflects whether there is evidence that a parent rating scale was sent out during the baseline interval

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Patients Whose Parent Rating Scale Was Returned
primary_outcome.description: This measure is based on chart review of patients of clinicians in each study arm (up to 4 patients per clinician) and reflects whether there is evidence that a parent rating scale was received by the clinician during the baseline interval

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Patients Who Were Sent the Teacher Rating Scale
primary_outcome.description: This measure is based on chart review of patients of clinicians in each study arm (up to 4 patients per clinician) and reflects whether there is evidence that a teacher rating scale was sent out during the baseline interval

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Patients Whose Teacher Rating Scale Was Returned
primary_outcome.description: This measure is based on chart review of patients of clinicians in each study arm (up to 4 patients per clinician) and reflects whether there is evidence that a teacher rating scale was received by the clinician during the baseline interval

primary_outcome.description: This measure is based on chart review of patients of clinicians in each study arm (up to 4 patients per clinician) and reflects whether there is evidence that a parent rating scale was sent out during the intervention interval

primary_outcome.description: This measure is based on chart review of patients of clinicians in each study arm (up to 4 patients per clinician) and reflects whether there is evidence that a parent rating scale was received by the clinician during the intervention interval

primary_outcome.description: This measure is based on chart review of patients of clinicians in each study arm (up to 4 patients per clinician) and reflects whether there is evidence that a teacher rating scale was sent out during the intervention interval

primary_outcome.description: This measure is based on chart review of patients of clinicians in each study arm (up to 4 patients per clinician) and reflects whether there is evidence that a teacher rating scale was received by the clinician during the intervention interval

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Patients Who Were Sent the Parent Rating Scale - by MOC Status
secondary_outcome.description: We calculated the percent of patient charts with evidence that a parent rating scale was sent out during the baseline period, separately for intervention clinicians who did and did not complete Maintenance of Certification (MOC) attestation.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Patients Whose Parent Rating Scale Was Returned- by MOC Status
secondary_outcome.description: We calculated the percent of patient charts with evidence that a parent rating scale was received by the clinician/practice during the baseline period, separately for intervention clinicians who did and did not complete Maintenance of Certification (MOC) attestation.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Patients Who Were Sent the Teacher Rating Scale- by MOC Status
secondary_outcome.description: We calculated the percent of patient charts with evidence that a teacher rating scale was sent out during the baseline period, separately for intervention clinicians who did and did not complete Maintenance of Certification (MOC) attestation.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Patients Whose Teacher Rating Scale Was Returned- by MOC Status
secondary_outcome.description: We calculated the percent of patient charts with evidence that a teacher rating scale was received by the clinician/practice during the baseline period, separately for intervention clinicians who did and did not complete Maintenance of Certification (MOC) attestation.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Patients Who Were Sent the Parent Rating Scale- by MOC Status
secondary_outcome.description: We calculated the percent of patient charts with evidence that a parent rating scale was sent out during the intervention period, separately for intervention clinicians who did and did not complete Maintenance of Certification (MOC) attestation.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Patients Whose Parent Rating Scale Was Returned- by MOC Status
secondary_outcome.description: We calculated the percent of patient charts with evidence that a parent rating scale was received by the clinician/practice during the intervention period, separately for intervention clinicians who did and did not complete Maintenance of Certification (MOC) attestation.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Patients Who Were Sent the Teacher Rating Scale- by MOC Status
secondary_outcome.description: We calculated the percent of patient charts with evidence that a teacher rating scale was sent out during the intervention period, separately for intervention clinicians who did and did not complete Maintenance of Certification (MOC) attestation.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Patients Whose Teacher Rating Scale Was Returned- by MOC Status
secondary_outcome.description: We calculated the percent of patient charts with evidence that a teacher rating scale was received by the clinician/practice during the intervention period, separately for intervention clinicians who did and did not complete Maintenance of Certification (MOC) attestation.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Patients Who Were Sent the Parent Rating Scale- by Feedback Call Participation
secondary_outcome.description: We calculated the percent of patient charts with evidence that a parent rating scale was sent out during the baseline period, separately for intervention clinicians who did and did not participate in at least one performance feedback call.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Patients Whose Parent Rating Scale Was Returned- by Feedback Call Participation
secondary_outcome.description: We calculated the percent of patient charts with evidence that a parent rating scale was received by the clinician/practice during the baseline period, separately for intervention clinicians who did and did not participate in at least one performance feedback call.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Patients Who Were Sent the Teacher Rating Scale- by Feedback Call Participation
secondary_outcome.description: We calculated the percent of patient charts with evidence that a teacher rating scale was sent out during the baseline period, separately for intervention clinicians who did and did not participate in at least one performance feedback call.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Patients Whose Teacher Rating Scale Was Returned- by Feedback Call Participation
secondary_outcome.description: We calculated the percent of patient charts with evidence that a teacher rating scale was received by the clinician/practice during the baseline period, separately for intervention clinicians who did and did not participate in at least one performance feedback call.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Patients Who Were Sent the Parent Rating Scale- by Feedback Call Participation
secondary_outcome.description: We calculated the percent of patient charts with evidence that a parent rating scale was sent out during the intervention period, separately for intervention clinicians who did and did not participate in at least one performance feedback call.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Patients Whose Parent Rating Scale Was Returned- by Feedback Call Participation
secondary_outcome.description: We calculated the percent of patient charts with evidence that a parent rating scale was received by the clinician/practice during the intervention period, separately for intervention clinicians who did and did not participate in at least one performance feedback call.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Patients Who Were Sent the Teacher Rating Scale- by Feedback Call Participation
secondary_outcome.description: We calculated the percent of patient charts with evidence that a teacher rating scale was sent out during the intervention period, separately for intervention clinicians who did and did not participate in at least one performance feedback call.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Patients Whose Teacher Rating Scale Was Returned- by Feedback Call Participation
secondary_outcome.description: We calculated the percent of patient charts with evidence that a teacher rating scale was received by the clinician/practice during the intervention period, separately for intervention clinicians who did and did not participate in at least one performance feedback call.

secondary_outcome.measure: Implementation Outcome: Number of Clinicians Who Completed All 3 Educational Presentations
secondary_outcome.description: We assessed the proportion of clinicians randomized to the intervention group that completed all 3 educational presentations.

secondary_outcome.measure: Implementation Outcome: Number of Clinicians Who Used the Collaborative Consultation Component
secondary_outcome.description: We calculated the proportion of clinicians in the intervention group that posted in the online networking site which was used to facilitate collaborative consultation.

secondary_outcome.measure: Implementation Outcome: Number of Clinicians Who Participated in at Least One Performance Feedback Call
secondary_outcome.description: We calculated the proportion of clinicians in the intervention group who participated in at least one of the four performance feedback calls that were held during the study period.

secondary_outcome.measure: Implementation Outcome: Number of Clinicians Who Participated in All Intervention Components and Attested to Fulfilling MOC Requirements
secondary_outcome.description: We calculated the proportion of clinicians in the intervention group who completed all components of the intervention and attested to fulfilling MOC requirements.

arm_group.description: Clinicians in the intervention arm will receive the three-part intervention (Supporting Practice for ADHD, or SPA) which includes: education about ADHD management and communication training, collaborative consultation, and performance feedback, for the first 8 months of the study.
Clinicians in the control arm will receive no intervention for the first 8 months of the study, then will receive the full SPA intervention for the last 8 months of the study.

intervention.description: The SPA intervention will last for 8 months for each study arm (first 8 months of the study for the intervention group, last 8 months for the control group). The intervention includes 3 components: 1) a series of web-based educational presentations to provide education to providers about evidence-based practice for managing ADHD and strategies for promoting effective communication with families 2) Collaborative consultation designed to address clinical issues arising in practice will be provided by members of the study team. 3) Providers will be given systematic performance feedback with regard to their use of evidence-based practices for ADHD every 2 months during the 8-month intervention period.

criteria.textblock:
Primary Subjects: Clinicians
Inclusion Criteria:
- Non-resident clinician (physician or nurse practitioner) at participating site
Exclusion Criteria:
- Residents
Secondary Subjects: Families
Inclusion Criteria:
- Children aged 5-12 years receiving care from a clinician enrolled in the study for ADHD and their parents
Exclusion Criteria:
- Autism spectrum disorder

participant_flow.recruitment_details: Note: The same group of 105 clinicians participated during both periods. Charts were reviewed for a different random sample of patients in each period (790 patients in total: 391 in the baseline and 399 in the intervention period)

group.title: Intervention Clinicians
group.description: Clinicians in the intervention arm received the three-part intervention (Supporting Practice for ADHD, or SPA) which includes: education about ADHD management and communication training, collaborative consultation, and performance feedback, for the first 8 months of the study.

group.title: Control Clinicians
group.description: Clinicians in the control arm received no intervention for the first 8 months of the study, then received the full SPA intervention for the last 8 months of the study.

group.title: Patients of Intervention Clinicians
group.description: Children aged 5-12 with ADHD seen by a clinician in the intervention group during the study period.

group.title: Patients of Control Clinicians
group.description: Children aged 5-12 with an ADHD diagnosis seen by clinicians in the control group during the study period.

group.title: Intervention Clinicians
group.description: Clinicians in the intervention arm received the three-part intervention (Supporting Practice for ADHD, or SPA) which includes: education about ADHD management and communication training, collaborative consultation, and performance feedback, for the first 8 months of the study.

group.title: Control Clinicians
group.description: Clinicians in the control arm received no intervention for the first 8 months of the study, then received the full SPA intervention for the last 8 months of the study.

group.title: Patients of Intervention Clinicians
group.description: Children aged 5-12 with ADHD seen by a clinician in the intervention group during the study period.

group.title: Patients of Control Clinicians
group.description: Children aged 5-12 with an ADHD diagnosis seen by clinicians in the control group during the study period.

group.title: Total
group.description: Total of all reporting groups

measure.title: Age
measure.population: Age was only measured for patients.

measure.title: Sex: Female, Male
Ethnicity (NIH/OMB)
measure.population: Ethnicity was only recorded for patients.

measure.title: Race/Ethnicity, Customized
measure.population: Race was only recorded for patients.

measure.title: Insurance payer
measure.population: Insurance payer was only recorded for patients.

measure.title: Provider Type
measure.population: Provider type is only applicable to clinician participants.

measure.title: Baseline Perception of Acceptability of Managing ADHD in Primary Care- Assessing ADHD
measure.description: These items are from the previously validated ADHD Questionnaire for Primary Care Providers. Scores ranged from 1 to 4, with 4 indicating the highest level of acceptability for each practice activity.
measure.population: This measure only applies to clinicians.

measure.title: Baseline Perception of Acceptability of Managing ADHD in Primary Care- Providing Mental Health Care
measure.description: These items are from the previously validated ADHD Questionnaire for Primary Care Providers. Scores ranged from 1 to 4, with 4 indicating the highest level of acceptability for each practice activity.
measure.population: This measure only applies to clinicians.

measure.title: Baseline Perception of Acceptability of Managing ADHD in Primary Care- Recommending Medications
measure.description: These items are from the previously validated ADHD Questionnaire for Primary Care Providers. Scores ranged from 1 to 4, with 4 indicating the highest level of acceptability for each practice activity.
measure.population: This measure only applied to clinicians.

measure.title: Perceived effectiveness at managing ADHD in primary care
measure.description: These items are from the previously validated ADHD Questionnaire for Primary Care Providers. Scores ranged from 1 to 4, with 4 indicating the highest level of acceptability for each practice activity.
measure.population: This measure only applies to clinicians.

outcome.title: Number of Patients Who Were Sent the Parents Rating Scale
outcome.description: This measure is based on chart review of patients of clinicians in each study arm (up to 4 patients per clinician) and reflects whether there is evidence that a parent rating scale was sent out during the baseline interval
outcome.population: We reviewed charts for a total of 402 patients of intervention clinicians (200 who had an office visit in the 8-month baseline period and 202 who had an office visit in the 8-month intervention period). We reviewed charts for a total of 388 patients of control clinicians (191 in the baseline period and 197 in the control period).

outcome.title: Number of Patients Who Were Sent the Parent Rating Scale - by MOC Status
outcome.description: We calculated the percent of patient charts with evidence that a parent rating scale was sent out during the baseline period, separately for intervention clinicians who did and did not complete Maintenance of Certification (MOC) attestation.
outcome.population: This outcome was only assessed for patients of clinicians in the intervention group, and compared patients of clinicians who did and did not fulfill all requirements to receive Maintenance of Certification (MOC) credit. The MOC group included 76 patients in the baseline and 73 in the intervention period. The non-MOC group included 124 and 129.

group.title: Patients of Intervention Clinicians Completing MOC Attestation
group.description: Children aged 5-12 with ADHD seen by a clinician in the intervention group who fulfilled all requirements to receive Maintenance of Certification (MOC) credit.

group.description: Children aged 5-12 with ADHD seen by a clinician in the intervention group who did not fulfill all requirements to receive Maintenance of Certification (MOC) credit.

outcome.title: Number of Patients Who Were Sent the Parent Rating Scale- by Feedback Call Participation
outcome.description: We calculated the percent of patient charts with evidence that a parent rating scale was sent out during the baseline period, separately for intervention clinicians who did and did not participate in at least one performance feedback call.
outcome.population: This outcome was only assessed for patients of clinicians in the intervention group, and compared patients of clinicians who did and did not participate in at least one performance feedback call. The feedback call group included 115 patients in the baseline and 112 in the intervention period. The non-feedback call group included 85 and 90.

outcome.title: Implementation Outcome: Number of Clinicians Who Completed All 3 Educational Presentations
outcome.description: We assessed the proportion of clinicians randomized to the intervention group that completed all 3 educational presentations.
outcome.population: This outcome was only assessed for intervention clinicians.

group.title: Intervention Clinicians
group.description: Clinicians in the intervention arm received the three-part intervention (Supporting Practice for ADHD, or SPA) which includes: education about ADHD management and communication training, collaborative consultation, and performance feedback, for the first 8 months of the study.

group.title: Control Clinicians
group.description: Clinicians in the control arm received no intervention for the first 8 months of the study, then received the full SPA intervention for the last 8 months of the study.

measure.title: Implementation Outcome: Number of Clinicians Who Completed All 3 Educational Presentations
measure.description: We assessed the proportion of clinicians randomized to the intervention group that completed all 3 educational presentations.
measure.population: This outcome was only assessed for intervention clinicians.

outcome.title: Implementation Outcome: Number of Clinicians Who Used the Collaborative Consultation Component
outcome.description: We calculated the proportion of clinicians in the intervention group that posted in the online networking site which was used to facilitate collaborative consultation.
outcome.population: This outcome was only assessed for intervention clinicians.

group.title: Intervention Clinicians
group.description: Clinicians in the intervention arm received the three-part intervention (Supporting Practice for ADHD, or SPA) which includes: education about ADHD management and communication training, collaborative consultation, and performance feedback, for the first 8 months of the study.

group.title: Control Clinicians
group.description: Clinicians in the control arm received no intervention for the first 8 months of the study, then received the full SPA intervention for the last 8 months of the study.

measure.title: Implementation Outcome: Number of Clinicians Who Used the Collaborative Consultation Component
measure.description: We calculated the proportion of clinicians in the intervention group that posted in the online networking site which was used to facilitate collaborative consultation.
measure.population: This outcome was only assessed for intervention clinicians.

outcome.title: Implementation Outcome: Number of Clinicians Who Participated in at Least One Performance Feedback Call
outcome.description: We calculated the proportion of clinicians in the intervention group who participated in at least one of the four performance feedback calls that were held during the study period.
outcome.population: This outcome was only assessed for intervention clinicians.

group.title: Intervention Clinicians
group.description: Clinicians in the intervention arm received the three-part intervention (Supporting Practice for ADHD, or SPA) which includes: education about ADHD management and communication training, collaborative consultation, and performance feedback, for the first 8 months of the study.

group.title: Control Clinicians
group.description: Clinicians in the control arm received no intervention for the first 8 months of the study, then received the full SPA intervention for the last 8 months of the study.

measure.title: Implementation Outcome: Number of Clinicians Who Participated in at Least One Performance Feedback Call
measure.description: We calculated the proportion of clinicians in the intervention group who participated in at least one of the four performance feedback calls that were held during the study period.
measure.population: This outcome was only assessed for intervention clinicians.

outcome.title: Implementation Outcome: Number of Clinicians Who Participated in All Intervention Components and Attested to Fulfilling MOC Requirements
outcome.description: We calculated the proportion of clinicians in the intervention group who completed all components of the intervention and attested to fulfilling MOC requirements.
outcome.population: This outcome was only assessed for intervention clinicians.

group.title: Intervention Clinicians
group.description: Clinicians in the intervention arm received the three-part intervention (Supporting Practice for ADHD, or SPA) which includes: education about ADHD management and communication training, collaborative consultation, and performance feedback, for the first 8 months of the study.

group.title: Control Clinicians
group.description: Clinicians in the control arm received no intervention for the first 8 months of the study, then received the full SPA intervention for the last 8 months of the study.

measure.title: Implementation Outcome: Number of Clinicians Who Participated in All Intervention Components and Attested to Fulfilling MOC Requirements
measure.description: We calculated the proportion of clinicians in the intervention group who completed all components of the intervention and attested to fulfilling MOC requirements.
measure.population: This outcome was only assessed for intervention clinicians.

reported_events.time_frame: 16 months (8 month baseline period and 8 month intervention period)

group.title: Intervention Clinicians
group.description: Clinicians in the intervention arm received the three-part intervention (Supporting Practice for ADHD, or SPA) which includes: education about ADHD management and communication training, collaborative consultation, and performance feedback, for the first 8 months of the study.

group.title: Control Clinicians
group.description: Clinicians in the control arm received no intervention for the first 8 months of the study, then received the full SPA intervention for the last 8 months of the study.

group.title: Patients of Intervention Clinicians
group.description: Children aged 5-12 with ADHD seen by a clinician in the intervention group during the study period.

group.title: Patients of Control Clinicians
group.description: Children aged 5-12 with an ADHD diagnosis seen by clinicians in the control group during the study period.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: All Principal Investigators ARE employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: There is NOT an agreement between Principal Investigators and the Sponsor (or its agents) that restricts the PI's rights to discuss or publish trial results after the trial is completed.

clinical_results.limitations_and_caveats: Enrollment occurred within 1 health system among clinicians who were interested in participating in the project and worked in practices that agreed to participate, which may limit generalizability of results.
